messages.message: I created a project using 10K documents, created an app from this and ran a set of documents through the app. Many of the documents were the same I used to create the project (some were different), and yet all of them were classified as Other, with no fields found. https://aihub.instabase.com/hub/apps/f5a78a2f-c62b-403e-9c4e-1295137162ca/batch/3d80bb74-81a9-430e-83f3-40cbb6a78114
Did you rename your class from what was auto-suggested?
When you add new 10K docs to your project, do they get classified correctly? or do they get put in other?

Right now, the build app doesn’t really have any indication of how well the model classifies. You could rename the suggested class to something, and the model could be terrible at classifying it as the renamed class. Something to fix in the next iteration of classification for sure!

I uploaded about 35 files. Most of them were classified under “Form 10k”, one was classified under “Form 10Q” and 2 were classified under “Financial Documents”. I moved the 2 documents under “Financial Documents” into “Form 10k” and deleted that class. I didn’t do any other renaming though
btw I don’t know how to open someone else’s project
I think you have to be admin :disappointed:
hmm, so docs that were correctly classified as Form 10K during development were put in “Other” during app run?
yep exactly
can you upload here a couple of the docs that were wrong?
can you open the ibclassifier file for your app? and take a screenshot of the custom classifier
looks like it doesn’t have any classes lol
yea that looks like the flow was generated incorrectly.
@Arjun can you generate another flow (i think if you click update app it will create a new one?) and see if the classes are still missign?
@lydia yep, updating app seems to have generated the right flow
any idea what would have caused this? I wouldn’t necessarily expect users to know that they should update their app if their results look wrong
Yea I agree. cc @Kathy Wu can you think of a way where generating a flow would only create the “other” class, but not the actual classes in the project?
it’s getting the schema from the frontend right?
does the schema json have the other classes in the project? i think we just take the classes from there
yeah, nothing changed in the project schema
